section.title: Fund Transfers
section.para: In an international trade transaction, you can use this Fund Transfers (FT) module to request a fund transfer, for which the bank (called the Ordering Bank) can subsequently send an acknowledgement upon successful completion.

section.title: Overview
section.para: This module is a simple Cash Management feature. It enables you, on behalf of your company (the applicant) to do three types of transfer: Internal transfer, which you use to transfer funds between two accounts both belonging to your company in the same bank, Third Party Transfer, which you use to transfer funds to an external beneficiary in the same bank, and Domestic, which you use to transfer funds between accounts of your company in different banks but in the same country.

section.title: Functions
section.para: The menu for this module has the following groups of functions.

However, the Fund Transfers module is associated with a single event (the submission of the transfer request and the bank's reply), and therefore there are no functions to send amendments or free-format messages to the bank.

section.title: FT Initiation
section.para: This section describes the Fund Transfer Initiation function and the forms it uses.

section.title: FT Initiation Functions
section.para: This part of the menu contains several functions, providing different ways to request a Fund Transfer.

section.title: Internal Transfer
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request for a transfer between two accounts at the same bank belonging to your company.
This function displays a blank form. The electronic form asks for limited information such as the ordering and beneficiary accounts, and the currency and amount of the transfer.

section.title: Third Party Transfer
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request for a transfer from your company's account to an external beneficiary account in the same bank.
This function displays a blank form. It is similar to the form for an internal transfer.

section.title: Domestic Transfer
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request for a transfer from your company's account to an account in another bank in the same country, where your company holds an account.
This function displays a blank form. It is similar to the form for an internal transfer.

section.title: From Template
section.para: Create a Fund Transfer request or template from a template that you have previously created.
Most of the information for the transaction is defaulted except key data such as the expiry date or the currency and amount of the new Fund Transfer.
This function displays a list of your existing Fund Transfer templates. You can search the list by entering search criteria in the Reference and/or Description fields at the top of the page.

The columns show the Reference and Description of each template. You can modify the description of a template by clicking the Edit
icon, or delete a template by clicking the Delete
icon.

Click in the Reference column to open a new Fund Transfer form, populated with the details from the selected template. After completing the form you can save it as either a new Fund Transfer or a new template.

section.title: Edit Transactions
section.para: Review, complete and submit records that a user has already created and saved, but not submitted.

When this option is selected from the side navigation menu of the Cash services > Fund Transfers page, it allows a Fund Transfer request that a user has already started and saved, to be completed. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.
Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it for further editing.

section.title: Retrieve Unsigned
section.para: Review and submit records that a user has, but have not been submitted due to lack of authority.

When selected, this option will present a list of Fund Transfer requests that have been prepared and saved by users in the bank, but have not been successfully submitted to the clients because the user had insufficient privileges. Records that were simply saved with no attempt to submit them are not included. Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. Only complete the fields that are required for the filter.

Click on the System ID column of the required entry to open it in a non-editable mode, in order to review the data and perform the submission. When clicked, the Users icon will display the user that created the transaction, and any users that have edited, authorised or verified it.

If there is sufficient authorisation in the users profile, multiple records can be submitted in a single operation directly from the list. Each record in the list has a check box which when selected is ticked. A button at the end of the page submits all the selected records.

The result of the action is then returned, with a list of records that have now been successfully sent to the clients, together with a list of records that have again failed validation. The updated list of unsigned records is then also displayed.

section.title: Pending FTs
section.para: This function will display a list of all Fund Transfer (FT) records that have not been approved by the bank and the ones that are in draft state.

section.title: Pending FTs - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the Pending FTs function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Fund Transfers. Then select Pending FTs from the left side navigation menu.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, the link to the Pending FTs function may already be available in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: Pending Fund Transfer Transactions
section.para: To use the Pending Fund Transfer function, after selecting Cash Services > Fund Transfers from the toolbar, click on Pending FTs on the left side navigation menu. These Fund Transfer transactions can be edited or submitted as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Status, Account Number, Product type, Customer Ref, Ccy, Minimum and Maximum Amounts, Counterparty or Last Modified Dates fields. To display all records, enter an asterisk in any of the criteria fields.
The columns returned in the list of Fund Transfer records are the following:

section.title: FT Inquiry
section.para: This function will display a list of all Fund Transfer (FT) records that have been approved by the bank. These can be view or printed as required.

section.title: FT Inquiry - Navigation
section.para: To navigate to the FT Inquiry function, from the tool bar, select Cash Services > Fund Transfers. Then select FT Inquiry from the left side navigation menu.
Alternatively, depending on the Cash Services function already selected, the link to the FT Inquiry function may already be available in the left hand side navigation menu.

section.title: FT Inquiry
section.para: To use this function, after selecting Fund Transfers from the toolbar, click on Pending FTs on the left side navigation menu. These Fund transfer transactions can be viewed as required by any user with the appropriate authorities.

Click the Search Options link to display the fields that can be used to filter the list. These are Entity, System ID, Status, Account Number, Product Type, Customer Ref, Ccy, Minimum and Maximum Amounts, Counterparty or Last Modified Dates fields.
